message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.HC. 

The paper deals with human action classification using computer vision techniques, which falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The use of linear support vector machines for classification suggests a machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also involves the extraction and analysis of features, which could fall under multimedia (cs.MM) or information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-categories. Finally, the application of human action classification has implications for human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category.
